item.title: Report E-2025010292
item.description:
Report E-2025010292

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: STURTEVANT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from three (3) 1-gallon metal pails fox a box containing four (4) 1-gallon pails were crushed due to improperly loaded freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum for all waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025010049
item.description:
Report I-2025010049

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-31
  • City: Bonduel
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While unloading, one 2.5 gallon jug fell from pallet and was damaged. Free product released to trailer floor and gravel surface beneath. Valley Environmental was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Valley Environmental applied absorbent material to the affected areas and neutralized the free product, which was recovered into one 55-gallon recovery drum, along with contaminated cardboard and debris. The damaged 2.5g jug was placed into one 10-gallon overpack drum and secured with absorbent boom. Disposal was coordinated in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report I-2025010051
item.description:
Report I-2025010051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: Horicon
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WISCONSIN & SOUTHERN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While FRA was doing a routine Hazmat inspection, PROX 45611 was found to be Leaking from the bottom outlet cap. Team placed absorbent pads under the car initially. The car was then moved to a track where a bucket was placed underneath to catch any residue Leaking until RESCAR is able to inspect and repair the car.
